lines.text: Nature's first green is gold, / Her hardest hue to hold. / Her early leaf's a flower, / But only so an hour. / Then leaf subsides to leaf, / So Eden sank to grief. / So dawn goes down to day, / Nothing gold can stay.
Where did you learn that? That's what I meant.
Robert Frost wrote it. I always remembered it because I never quite knew what he meant.

[his last lines]
Stay gold, Ponyboy. Stay gold.
[last lines]
Paul Newman,and a ride home.
Hate to tell you this buddy, but you have to wear clothes to work. There's a law or something.

Ponyboy, I asked the nurse to give you this book so you could finish it.The doctor came in a while ago but I already knew it anyway.I keep getting tireder and tireder.Listen,I don't mind dying now.It was worth it. It was worth saving those kids.Their lives are worth more than mine,they have more to live for.Some of the parents came by to thank me and I know it was worth it.Tell Dally it was worth it.I'm just gonna miss you guys. I've been thinking about it,and that poem , that guy that wrote it , he meant you are gold when you're a kid,like green. When you're a kid everything is new , dawn. It's just. When just when you get used to everything it's day. Like the way you dig sunsets,Pony. That's Gold. Keep it that way,it's a good way to be.I want you to tell Dally to look at one.He'll probably think you're crazy , but ask for me. I don't think he's ever really seen a sunset.And don't be bugged over being a greaser. You still have a lot of time to make yourself be what you want. There's still alot od good in the world.Tell Dally. I don't think he knows. Your Buddy, Johnny
We gotta win that fight tonight. We gotta get even with those Socs! Let's do it for Johnny, man. We'll do it for Johnny!

[In the "Complete Novel" version; after Sodapop runs out from Ponyboy and Darry's fight, Ponyboy tackles him]
God damn it Ponyboy, you should have gone out for football instead of track.

[On the ground]
Where the hell do you think you're going?
I don't know, man. It's just like sometimes I have to get out. It's like I'm the middle man in a tug-of-war or something between you guys. I don't know, I can't take sides.
[Sits down. To Ponyboy]

Ponyboy, Darry could've put you in a boys' home, worked his way through college. I'm telling you the truth, Pony. I'm happy working at a gas station. Working with cars. I'm dumb. It's alright, I don't mind. You're not Pony. You'd never be happy doing something like that.
[to Darry]
Darry, you gotta stop yelling at him for every little thing he does, man. I mean he, he feels things differently than you. Bad enough to have to
[sniffling]

to listen to you. But when you start trying to get me to take sides. We're all we got left now. If we don't have each other, then we ain't got nothing. And when you ain't got nothin, you end up like Dally... I don't mean dead either, I mean, I mean how he was before. So please...
[Starts crying]
don't fight anymore... please...
Sure... sure little buddy, we ain't goin' to fight anymore.
[Hugs Sodapop]

[Sees Ponyboy looking left out and crying]
Ponyboy... Pony.
[Ponyboy goes over to hug Sodapop]
Now don't you start bawlin' too Pony. One bawl-baby in this family's enough.

[Crying]
I ain't cryin.
Let's go home. I'm cold.
[They get up and race each other home]
You guys know what Greasers are? White trash with long, greasy hair.
You know what a Soc is?
What?
White trash with mustangs and madras.
[spits at Bob]
It's like the mist is what's pretty, ya know? All gold and silver.
Hmm
Too bad it can't stay like that all the time.
Nothing gold can stay.

[hugging Darrel]
Darry!

[crying]
I thought we lost you like we did Mom and Dad.
Leave her alone, Dal.
What'd you say?
Come on, you heard me. Leave her alone.
What'd you say, you little shit? What'd you say to me? Wise ass.
[Dallas yells at a doctor after seeing Johnny die]
WHY DO YOU BOTHER HELPING PEOPLE, HUH? It doesen't do any good.
Darry hit me! I swear, we used to get along just fine until Mom and Dad died. Now he can't stand me.
I think I like it better when the old man's hittin' me. At least he knows I'm there.

[passing Ponyboy while lying on a stretcher at the hospital after saving the children from the burning church]
You ever pull a stunt like that again, I'll kill you.

I used to talk about killing myself all the time, man. But I don't wanna die now. It ain't long enough. Sixteen years ain't gonna be long enough. Hell, I wouldn't care so much if there hadn't been so many things I haven't done yet. So many damn things I ain't seen or done. That time when we were in Windrixville was the only time I've ever been away from my neighborhood.
[first lines]
Paul Newman, and a ride home.
I don't like little kids. I just, I just don't like them.
What's goin on Dal?

[Smoking a cigarette]
We're early.
What do you want to do?

[Smiles]
Nothin legal man. Let's get outa here.

[after climbing through the church windows, of Jerry]
Is the guy coming?
No.
Why? Too scared?
Naw, too fat, man.
Can't you leave us alone? BE NICE AND LEAVE US ALONE!
I'm never nice. Can I interest you in a Coca-Cola or a 7-Up?
GET LOST, HOOD!

[Two-Bit is wrestling him]
I gotta cut smoking or I'll never make track next year.
You smoke more than a pack today and I'll skin you. Understood?
Yeah. You carry more than one bundle of roofing at a time and me an' Soda'll skin you. Understood?
Shoot, this house ain't dirty. You ought to see my house.
I have and if you had the sense of a billy goat, you'd clean your house up 'stead of bummin' 'round ours.
Shoot kid, if I did that, my mom would die of shock.
I hope I never see Dallas Winston again. If I do I'd... probably fall in love with him.
[Ponyboy has fainted and is delirious following the death of Johnny and Dally]
Soda, is somebody sick?
Yeah, somebody's sick...
I killed him. I killed that boy.
[Quiet, scared voice]
I killed him.
I think I'm gonna be sick
Go ahead man, I won't look at you.
What's happened to your gown?
I threw it away.

[rolls eyes]
I can't wait till you're outta here.
Get out, just get out! You're making me sick in my stomach.
[laughs]
What are you thinking about me becoming your personal bodyguard huh Ponyboy?
I don't think it's too hot of an idea.

[of Pony with his hair bleached]
Look at the blonde-headed monkey!

Listen, with your brains and grades, you could get a scholarship, and we could put you through college, ain't that right, Soda? But you're livin' in a vaccuum, Pony, and you're gonna have to cut it out. You just don't stop living because you lose somebody. I thought you knew that. And anytime you don't like the way I'm running things around here, you can just get out, ALL RIGHT?
YOU'D LIKE THAT, WOULDN'T YOU? YOU'D LIKE ME TO JUST GET THE HELL OUT! Well it's not that easy, is it, Soda?
GOD DAMN, YOU GUYS! LEAVE ME OUT OF IT!
Man that was one tough car. Mustangs, they're tough.

[Pulls Dallas over for speeding]
Where's the fire?

[Lying]
This kid fell off his motorcycle, I'm taking him to the hospital.
Is he hurt bad?
How should I know? I ain't no doc.
[Cop goes away]
*Sucker.*
Here, I thought this might cool you off.
[hands Cherry a coke and sits right next to her]

[takes the straw out of her coke and throws it in Dally's face]
Maybe that'll cool YOU off, Greaser... when you learn to talk and act decent, then maybe I'll cool off too.

[wipes some of the coke off his face and goes in for Cherry]
Firey, huh? Just the way I like them!

[tries to push Dallas off]
GET OFF OF ME!
Come on...
Look, leave her alone, Dal!
What'd you say?

[a little bit frightened]
Come on Dal, you heard me.
What'd you say? What'd you say you little shit? What'd you say to me?
Come on...
Wiseass!
[seconds later he gets up and leaves]
Now you blew it.

[Turns to Johnny]
Thank you... he had me scared to death!
You sure didn't show it. Ain't nobody ever talk to Dal like that!
From what I saw, you do.
[Ponyboy comes home]
00 in the morning, kiddo!

[sleepily]
Hey, Pony. Where you been?
Fell asleep in the lot.
You WHAT?
I was talking to Johnny and I fell asleep in the lot, didn't mean to.
Yeah, hey!
[tries to close the bedroom door after him but Darry flings it open and follows]
And I can't even call the cops because you two would be put in a boys' home so fast it would make your heads spin.
Come on, Pony. Let's go to bed now.
Look, I said I didn't mean to!
"I didn't mean to", "I forgot". That's all I ever hear from you!
Come on, Darry...
YOU SHUT UP! I'M SICK AND TIRED OF HEARING YOU STICK UP FOR HIM! YOU HEAR ME?
Don't you yell at him!

[Darrel hits him]
Ponyboy, I didn't mean to.
["shooting" at cops]
You're never gonna get me alive!

[Two-Bit and Ponyboy are at the hospital visiting Johnny. Mrs. Cade is furious because the nurses won't let her in]
I've got a RIGHT to see him! He's my son! He'd rather see these no-good punks than his own mother? You skum...

[near tears]
No wonder he hates your guts. You don't even care about him, you damn drunk. You go to hell. Go straight to hell.
You guys are three of the bravest kids I've seen in a long time. What are you guys? Professional heroes or somethin'?
...We're Greasers.
Are- Are you kiddin' me?
What do you guys want?
Johnny killed a Soc.
What? Alright. Good for you. Let's go.
Well I figured you could get us out if anyone could, Dal. I- I'm sorry I got you away from this party and all but I just don't know what to do, man.
Nah. I was just uh... I was just trying to get some sleep. I got in a fight with Shepard tonight. Wait a minute. Let me think about this mess. Get in.
[pulls Ponyboy and Johnny inside]
...Ponyboy are you wet?

You can't win. You know that, don't you? It doesn't matter if you whip us, you'll still be where you were before, at the bottom. And we'll still be the lucky ones at the top with all the breaks. It doesn't matter. Greasers will still be Greasers and Socs will still be Socs. It doesn't matter.
You think my old man gives a hang if I'm dead in a car wreck or drunk or in jail or something, he doesn't care but that doesn't bother me. You're not going anywhere.
Johnny, you don't know what a few months in jail can do to you, man. You get mean in jail, I just don't wanna see that happen to you like it happened to me, man. Understand?
I'm sorry. I didn't know you had this problem with yelling in my face.
You'd better wise up, Pony... you get tough like me and you don't get hurt. You look out for yourself and nothing can touch you, man.

I was crazy, you know that, Pony? I was crazy for wanting Johnny to stay out of trouble. If he was smart, like me, he wouldn't be in this mess. If he was smart like me, he wouldn't have ran into that church man. You better wise up Pony. You better wise up man. You get TOUGH like me and you don't get hurt! You watch out for yourself, and nothing can touch you man!
How old are ya'll anyway?
Fourteen.
Sixteen.
By the looks of it I thought you were both four...
Sixteen.

[to Ponyboy]
Why don't you just focus on girls and cars? Works of me.
I don't think I could ever tell Steve or Two-Bit or even Darry about the clouds and sunset. Just you and Sodapop. Maybe Cherry Valance.
Guess we're different, huh?
Shoot, yeah. Maybe they are.
Maybe you're right.
Don't you know a rumble ain't a rumble without me?
Soda, Soda are you in love with Sandy?
Mhmm...
...Whats it like?
Most of the time... its real nice.
[repeated line]

[muttering]
Sucker.
[the church is on fire]
What's going on?
Wonder how that started.
Jesus Christ!

[runs over to an injured Ponyboy]
Hey Pony... did they pull a blade on you?
Yeah...
Hey, they ain't gonna hurt you no more.
You know what a Soc is?
What?
White trash with Mustangs and madras!
[Spits a loogie in Bob's face]
Get him!

[at the drive-inn, Dallas, Ponyboy and Johnny sit behind two girls, both Socs]
Some cute redhead, huh?

[leans forward and into Cherry's ear]
Are you a reeaal red?

[she giggles slightly, but keeps her eyes on the movie]
Are you real? How can I find out if this is your real red hair? If this is the same red hair that you have on your... your...
[motioning to her skirt, then quickly to her face]
... these eyebrows.

[Dallas sits back and laughs. Cherry gives him an incredulous glare]
Get your feet off my chair and shut your trap.
Who's gonna make me, huh?
[rolling his eyes]
Who, your boyfriend?
You'd better leave us alone, or I'll call the cops.

[sarcastically, in mock fright]
Oh, my, my! You've got me scared to death. What am I gonna do now, Pony? This girl's making me shake.
Can't you just leave us alone? Be nice and leave us alone?

[grins]
I'm never nice.

[sitting up next to her again]
Can I interest you in a Coca-Cola, or a...

[interrupting]
Get lost, hood!
Wow, I'm sorry, I didn't know you had this problem with... yelling in my face.

[stands up]
Alright, I'll go. I know when I'm not wanted.

[sounding weak]
Soda?

[quietly]
Yeah?
Is somebody sick?
Yeah somebody's sick...
[pause]
Be quiet.Get to sleep.
Man, I thought New York was the only place to end up in a murder rap, Jesus Christ!

[the Greasers are on their way to the rumble to fight the Socs]
Listen, Soda. You and Ponyboy, if the fuzz show, you beat it out of there. Hey, we'll get jailed, but you two will get the boys home, you know what I'm sayin'?
Ain't nobody gonna call the fuzz in this neighborhood! Cause they know better!
[laughs]

[trying to get their attention again]
All the- Hey, hey! All the- Hey! All the same, you two beat it out of there, ya hear me?
where are Soda, and Super-dope, anyhow?
Super-what?
All brawn, no brains.

[the Soc's pull up in there car to find their girls with the greasers]
Hey! Cherry! What're you doin'?
[Cherry glares at him]
Just because we got a litte drunk...!
A *little*? You call reeling and passing out in the streets a little? Bob, I told you, I'm never going out with you when you're drinking again and I mean it!
Look, that doesn't mean you can go walkin' the streets with these bums.
Who you callin' bums, pal?
You! Look, Greaser, we got four more of us in the backseat.

[Two-Bit hands a broken pop bottle to Ponyboy and flips out his switchblade]
Then, pity the backseat.
If... if you're lookin' for a fight...
I am lookin' for a fight!
C'mon, put the knife down! C'mon!
C'mon! Right now, right now!
Stop! Stop it! I hate fights, alright? I hate them!
[to Bob]
We'll go home with you, just give me a minute.
Are you a real red head? Are you real? How can I find out if this is your real red hair? If this is the same red hair you have on your, uh, your, your, these eyebrows.

[offscreen]
Anybody home?
In here, don't slam the door.
[Two Bit and Steve slam the door as Ponyboy rolls his eyes]

[mocking a Soc]
Hey check out their pants!
[laughs]
So, you guys waitin' for a floodin'?
And when you ain't got nothing, You end up like Dallas... And I don't mean dead. I mean the way he was before.

[hat just flew out the window]
Hey, look, I got me a new hat!
You know the only thing that keeps Darry from being a Soc is us.

[after Ponyboy gets jumped]
Hows the kid?
I'm fine. What are you doin' outta the cooler, Dal?
Yeah? And what are you doin' walkin' by your lonesome on the street?
It's none of your business smarty.
What do you mean, none of my business? It is my business. Look at my nose!
It's huge.
Smart-ass. He is a smart-ass kid.

[reading the paper]
They're thinking about putting me and Soda in a boys' home. No way! They ain't putting me in no boys' home.
Don't worry, Ponyboy, they don't do that to heroes. Hey, where is Soda and Super-dope, anyhow?
Hey, after we beat those Socs tonight, good me and Steve are gonna throw a huge party, and everyone's gonna get ripped!
OWWWW! WHOOO!
Where you gonna get the dough, li'l man?
Uhhh... I'll think of something.
[Sits on couch]
Hey Two-bit, Mickey's on TV!
[Two-bit sits in front of the TV to watch]
GET LOST HOOD!
God, I didn't know you had this problem with, with yelling in my face.

[to the little kids in the lot]
What? Look, now don't get wise. I don't like little kids, just don't like 'em. GET OUT OF HERE!
[chases kids out of the lot]

[Randy and friends walk up to Two bit and Ponyboy]
No jazz before the rumble; you know the rules, Ape Face
We know!
[looks over to Ponyboy]
I wanna talk to you.
Go ahead, I'll keep my eye on him.
Speaking about the rumble, pal...
I'm freezing, man.
Why didn't you bring a coat, stupid?
I forgot.
[a little girl with a kid comes over to Dally, Ponyboy, and Johnny]
Do you have 15 cents?
I don't have any money.
Do you have a dime?
Go away. We're busy here.
Do you...

[Annoyed by now]
Go away! Get out of here!

[When she is gone]
That was a close call.
[Ponyboy decides to run away with Johnny]
What happened?

[crying]
Darry hit me.
Pony, what's wrong?
Johnny's dead. Told him about beating the socs, I don't know. He just died. Told me to stay gold. Dally's gone. He couldn't take it, he's going to blow!
Beer for breakfast there, Two-Bit?
[in the hospital after the church fire]
You're young. You shouldn't be smoking. It's a hard habit to break.
Well, you're smoking.
I'm smoking but, I'm older than you are.
What do you think, man? You think it makes me look tough?
I think it makes you look different.
What'd you mean, "different"?
Well, you got a hole in your mouth.
It was your bright idea, smarty.

[in the court room]
They pushed me in the fountain and they tried to drown me, and they were gonna beat up Johnny Cade.
Hello Darrel. Long time no see.
Hello Paul.

[turns to Two-Bit]
What's up?
They used to buddy around together, play football.

[talking to Darry]
I'll take you.
[Darry smiles coldly]
Great. My first trip to the zoo!
You think my old man gives a hang if im dead in a car wreck, or drunk, or in jail or somethin', he doesn't care, but that doesn't bother me none. You're not going anywhere.
Hey baby, you wanna see what's hangin'?
Aw shut up Two-Bit before I hang you.
Let's take it outside!
